medical_history.chief_complaint: Itchy, indurated rash on the right foot.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 1 week after receiving a tetanus-diphtheria immunization, with the induration spreading centrifugally to form large plaques that became edematous and vesicular. Similar symptoms recurred months earlier, treated for presumed bacterial cellulitis. No other illnesses, medications, or immunizations preceded that episode.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Prior episode of itchy rash treated with antibiotics for presumed bacterial cellulitis. No chronic conditions specified.
